content:
65 
 
COURSE/  
DEGREE AWARDING  
INSTITUTIONS  
 REQUIREMENTS    
UTME SUBJECTS  
SPECIAL CONSIDERATION (WAIVER) REMARKS  
DIRECT ENTRY   UTME  
     a) AIB and other professional qualifications 
or HND in relevant programmes plus the 
UTME requirements.  
b) As in Accountancy.  
(xviii) UYO accepts ND/HND in relevant programmes 
not below lower credit level. All Direct Entry 
candidates must satisfy the UTME 
requirements.   
  
UTME  
(i) AAUA requires ‘O’ level credit passes in 
Economics plus one (1) Social Science subject 
and any other subject.  
(ii) AUN does not accept ‘O’ level credit passes in 
the following; Agriculture, Food and Nutrition,  
 Home  Economics,  Home  Craft,  Home  
Management, Physical Education, Physical and 
Health Education, Music, Commerce, 
Accounting, Financial Accounting, Book 
Keeping, Islamic Studies, History, Religious 
Studies, Tajweed, Library Studies, Diction, 
Kiswahili, Igbo, Hausa, Yoruba, Arabic, Turkish, 
Study Skills.  
(iii) AUN requires five (5) 'O' level credit passes 
including English Language, Mathematics, and 
any other three (3) subjects from the following: 
Economics, Geography, Government, History, 
Literature in English, Further Mathematics,  
Technical Drawing, Visual Arts, Computer 
Studies, Information Technology, Civics, 
Environmental Science, Biology, Physics, 
Chemistry and French.  
(iv) AAUA, UYO, UNIZIK, ESUTECH, EKSU, IMSU, 
PHC and LAGOS require ‘O’ level credit passes 
in Economics and two (2) other subjects.
